N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 451.6 - Establishment of safety groups

State Regulations
(a) In
order to establish a safety trade group, the proposed group manager will make
application in writing, giving a complete description of the type of risks to
be included in the group together with the nature of their operations and/or
the products that are manufactured, and detailed description of the proposed
accident-prevention and claims service. (b) When an industrial trade association
desires to have a group established for its members, such request must be made
on the letterhead of the association and signed by a duly authorized officer of
the association. A copy of the resolution of the board of directors of the
association requesting the establishment of the group must accompany the letter
of application, together with a complete description of the type of operations
intended to be included in the group and a detailed description of the
accident-prevention and claims services. The name and address of the proposed
group manager shall be given. Notes
